creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
inscription:
Signature, Title, Inscription

-- incribed in plate, bottom left: [Je fis ce qu'on appelle un bon marché]
-- in graphite on recto, bottom margin: C.D. 4 (preceded by crossed-out 3) | B 94 | A19710
provenance: John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie; gave to MIA, 2015. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
signed: signed in plate below central image: [Félix Buhot inv sct (superscript t)]
title: I Made What I Would Call a Good Bargain, from Le Chevalier des Touches
